channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2644] Wow really, Dairy Queen? [PIC]
[+1918] Texting teen falls down manhole
item.description: We all know that walking and texting is a tough combination but a Staten Island teen learned the hard way when she fell into an uncovered sewer manhole while trying to send a message.

item.title: [+1814] 31337 Vodka Shot Skills
item.description: It might be unwise to drop your jaw in amazement.

item.title: [+1609] TX Gov Appoints Creationist to Head TX Education - NBC
item.description: TX Governor Perry appoints science denying 'intelligent design' advocate to lead education agency.

item.title: [+1480] Kids Put Dad In Jail, 20 Yrs. Later Admit They Lied
item.description: The two adult children of former Vancouver police officer Clyde Ray Spencer, who spent nearly 20 years in prison after being convicted of molesting them, testified in court Friday the abuse never happened.

item.title: [+1435] How to get up, eat breakfast & get ready for work in 5 mins
item.description: Hilarious and you even get the techniques explained in this fun video from a Japanese Game Show

item.title: [+1371] Stunning Pics That Look Like They’re Photoshopped But Aren't
item.description: These Photos are not photoshopped in terms of that all the objects and their actions are real but might be edited for colors adjustments etc.

item.title: [+1206] Save the Planet. [pic]
[+1175] Mythbusters To Test Star Trek's Gorn Cannon
item.description: Mythbusters is finally going to take on Star Trek. Specifically they are going to test the feasibility of the cannon that Captain James T. Kirk built to defeat the Gorn in the original series Star Trek episode "Arena".

item.title: [+1159] Former CIGNA exec says Michael Moore was right all along
item.description: Bill Moyers exposes for the first time the health insurance industry's secret campaign against Michael Moore and his film, "Sicko." It contains a stunning revelation and admission by a top health insurance executive. Video at the link...

item.title: [+1125] Audra Shay: The GOP's Young Hatemonger
item.description: The Daily Beast revealed details of posts of her Facebook account. Specifically, a thread where one of her friends posts that ““Obama Bin Lauden [sic] is the new terrorist… Muslim is on there side [sic]… need to take this country back from all of these mad coons… and illegals,” and Shay responds eight minutes later with: “You tell em Eric! lol.”

item.title: [+1111] DIY Jailhouse Shotgun
item.description: DIY shotgun made in prison, using match-heads, AA batteries and broken light bulb.

item.title: [+1110] Animated Engines, Two Cylinder Stirling Engine
item.description: The Stirling engine is one of my favorites. It was invented in 1816 by Rev. Robert Stirling of Scotland. The Stirling is a very simple engine, and was often billed as a safe alternative to steam, since there's no risk of a boiler explosion. It enjoyed some success in industrial applications, and also in small appliances like fans and water pumps,

item.title: [+960] EMI refuses to sell music to Mom & Pop stores
item.description: Here’s a really good one for you. Last week EMI sales reps started making calls to many if not all of their small accounts, mostly independent mom & pop stores, to tell them that they would no longer sell them product!!!

item.title: [+928] Young GOP Chooses Hate
item.description: Audra Shay, the Young Republican leader accused of endorsing racism on Facebook, was elected head of the group for GOP members under 40 this afternoon.

item.title: [+847] July 11, 2009 - July 17, 2009 - Cartoons of the Week - TIME.

[+766] Monty Python film voted most controversial film of all time!
item.description: Now of course this is not the first, nor will it be the last time a most controversial film of all time list is done, so the fact that films like Caligula, The Cook The Thief His Wife and Her lover,Salo,The Last Temptation of Christ,Crash,Kids,The Birth of a Nation, The Passion of the Christ,Lolita,Deep Throat or Bad Lieutenant

item.title: [+766] Movie Theater Streams 2K Resolution Film Using BitTorrent
item.description: The MPAA has previously been critical of the negative effect it says BitTorrent has on the movie industry, but a recent experiment in a Norwegian movie theater shows that it might actually be of use to them. Researchers from The Far North Living Lab managed to stream a full 2K resolution film at 19mbit/s - with BitTorrent of course.

item.title: [+717] Trent Reznor: My thoughts on what to do as a new artist
item.description: The role of an independent musician these days requires a mastery of first hand use of these tools. Have a realistic idea of what you can expect to make from these and budget appropriately.
